journal-title-group.journal-title: Proceedings. Annual Conference on Taxation and Minutes of the Annual Meeting of the National Tax Association

title-group.article-title: FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY AND STUDENT DEBT

abstract.p: This paper presents estimates of the impact of student eligibility for federal financial aid on total student debt using a natural experiment created by the 1992 Amendment to the Higher Education Act of 1965. The amendment removed assets from the calculation of federal aid eligibility for families with earned income of less than $50,000 and excluded housing assets from eligibility calculation for all students. My results suggest each dollar of eligibility increases student debt by about 40 cents.
